DataElement.preferredName: Surgical Procedure Colostomy Or Ileostomy Performed Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Records a response to indicate if an operative procedure of a colostomy or an ileostomy was completed.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Surgical Procedure Colostomy Or Ileostomy Performed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to whether an operative procedure of a colostomy or an ileostomy was completed.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Used for operative procedures on organs, regions, or tissues in the treatment of diseases, including tissue section by lasers. It excludes transplantation, for which "transplantation" is used.

Concepts.definition: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.

Property.preferredDefinition: (ko-LAHS-toe-mee) An opening into the colon from the outside of the body. A colostomy provides a new path for waste material to leave the body after part of the colon has been removed.:An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:(il-ee-AHS-toe-mee) An opening into the ileum, part of the small intestine, from the outside of the body. An ileostomy provides a new path for waste material to leave the body after part of the intestine has been removed.:Executed and carried through to completion.

Concepts.definition: The surgical creation of an opening between the colon and the surface of the body.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
Surgical creation of an external opening into the ileum for fecal diversion or drainage. Loop or tube procedures are most often employed.
Executed and carried through to completion.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: justification for or explanation of the administration or cessation of therapy.

DataElementConcept.origin: COG CRF:Children's Oncology Group Case Report Form
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Changed from CTEP to COG for by script Thu Jan 2 10:00:57 EST 2014

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Unknown Refused Not Applicable Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Records the yes, no, unknown, refused,  or not applicable responses to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: To decline to do, accept, give, or allow something.

Concepts.definition: To decline to do, accept, give, or allow something.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2023.8.15 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0002731. ak

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Unknown Refuse Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.:Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.:To decline to do, accept, give, or allow something.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.
To decline to do, accept, give, or allow something.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 6/19/2020 jk released for reuse by NRG. 2017-02-27: These changes do not negatively impact the CDEs using this VD.  Remove "code" as a rep term qualifier.  Added "unknown" and "refused" as rep term qualifiers. Changed the long name and definition. Changed the conceptual domain from UML Model.  Added a max length.  Added PVs
